metadata.title: CVE-2023-52524 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:nfc: llcp: Add lock when modifying device list The device list needs itsassociated lock held when modifying it, or the list could become corrupted,as syzbot discovered.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52524` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-254-generic - 4.4.0-254.288~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-254-generic - 4.4.0-254.288~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-254-lowlatency - 4.4.0-254.288~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1131-aws - 4.4.0-1131.137
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1177-azure - 4.15.0-1177.192~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-254.288~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1131.137').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1177.192~14.04.1').
